primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in human history and individual lives to reveal His glory and make all things new, moving from a state of exile/meaninglessness to a state of restoration/revelation.

tekstueel_bewijs: God is still active, God moves, God determines.
God would keep his people, God would bless his people, and God would deliver them.
Behold, I make all things new.

object.identificatie: The Revelation of God's Glory / The 'New Thing'
tekstueel_bewijs: The glory of the Lord shall be revealed.
The best God has for us is yet to be.

ontvanger.identificatie: God's People (Israel, the Church, the Hearer)
tekstueel_bewijs: Comfort ye, comfort ye my people.
The glory of the Lord shall be revealed in us.
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is positioned as the Receiver of God's action.

tekstueel_bewijs: In Jesus, we have a new covenant.
Unto us a child is born.
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; Christ is the Mediator/Helper through whom the Subject acts.
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicitly the power behind the 'new heart' and 'new will'.

tegenstander.identificatie: Historical Empires, Sin, Death, and Human Agnosticism/Despair
tekstueel_bewijs: The evils of racism, war, and poverty.
Agnosticism means that we cannot know.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponents are not just personal bad habits but world-empires and ontological realities like death and pain.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The hearer adopting a 'Christian outlook' to recognize God's primary program.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The hearer's 'test' of faith is a response to the reality of God's prior and coming action.

voorbeelden: one does not want to be so fancy
score yourself as a Christian agnostic
How dare any Christian sigh and yawn
test of whether you do or do not have such an understanding
we see better than they how true was the word
what God can do and what he will do

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'Ability' (Pouvoir) which creates a new reality, rather than the hearer's 'Obligation' (Devoir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from ~S1 (Agnosticism) through S2 (The reality of Babylon/Exile) to the resolution in S1/ ~S2 (The New Jerusalem).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the sovereign 'About-to-be' of God that swallows up the chaos of history.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the sermon acknowledges the 'long and bitter night' and 'bleeding spirits' of exile.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the primary actor in history and in the future. Human action is framed as a response of 'looking' or 'believing' in what God is already doing.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: You may test yourself on this Christian outlook on life

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God is still active, God moves, God determines.
The glory of the Lord shall be revealed. It will happen!

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures/nations are used to show God's faithfulness, not as moral templates for the hearer to copy.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: Babylon (as an opponent overcome by God)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: Israel's return was God's doing, not their own merit.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Hope and assurance; relief from the burden of creating one's own meaning.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic emphasis on God's providence and eschatological completion.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the historical (Isaiah) to the personal (the hearer) to the cosmic (Revelation) is seamless.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'Christian agnostic' test at the start and the absolute certainty of God's action at the end.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The evils of racism, war, and poverty will be chained and banished.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the implied agent of the 'new heart' and 'new will' mentioned in the conclusion.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: High; sin is seen as 'exile', 'slavery', and 'darkness' that only God can break.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is powered by God's 'Pouvoir' (Power). The hearer is the 'Destinataire' (Receiver) of a 'New Thing' sent by God.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain this balance; it is the source of the sermon's power.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The 'Vouloir' (human desire) could be slightly more linked to the 'Pouvoir' of the Spirit.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Opponents (Babylon, Death, Racism) are already sufficiently heavy.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's About-to-be) correctly precedes and grounds the Ethics (the new walk/talk).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in theocentric preaching. It consistently maintains God as the Subject of the active verbs of history and salvation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'dawn song' imagery, Greimas reveals that the power comes from the Subject-switch from the failing human king (Zedekiah) to the acting God.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Babylonian context; semiotics shows how that context functions as a 'Heavy Opponent' that necessitates a Divine Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas highlights that the 'new heart' and 'new will' are not human achievements but 'Objects' given by the 'Sender' (God) to the 'Receiver'.

appendices.notnotes: The sermon avoids the 'If-Then' conditional trap, making it a pure proclamation of grace.
